metadata.title: CVE-2016-9804 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - negligible.
metadata.description: In BlueZ 5.42, a buffer overflow was observed in "commands_dump" function in "tools/parser/csr.c" source file. The issue exists because "commands" array is overflowed by supplied parameter due to lack of boundary checks on size of the buffer from frame "frm->ptr" parameter. This issue can be triggered by processing a corrupted dump file and will result in hcidump crash.

notes.note: mdeslaur> as of 2020-02-07, appears unfixed crash in hcidump command line tool only

criterions.comment: bluez package in impish is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
